comment.body:
When I open this link I'm redirected to `faselhdwatch.top` or `faselhd.cafe` and unfortunately I cannot reproduce popups and incorrect blocking.

Could you please add these rules:
```adblock
$script,third-party,domain=faselhd-watch.shop,badfilter
$third-party,xmlhttprequest,domain=faselhd-watch.shop,badfilter
faselhd-watch.shop$$script[wildcard="*function*break;case*"][min-length="30000"][max-length="100000"]
faselhd-watch.shop#%#//scriptlet("abort-current-inline-script", "document.createElement", "break;case $.")
```
to user rules and then check if issue still persist?

pull_request.title: Bump @adguard/aglint from 2.0.8 to 2.0.9
pull_request.body:
Bumps [@adguard/aglint](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AGLint) from 2.0.8 to 2.0.9.
Release notes

Sourced from @​adguard/aglint's releases.

v2.0.9

See CHANGELOG.md for the list of changes.

Changelog

Sourced from @​adguard/aglint's changelog.

[2.0.9] - 2024-04-25

Fixed

  • Validation for $permissions modifier #206.

Changed

  • Updated [@​adguard/agtree] to v1.1.8.

#206: AdguardTeam/AGLint#206 [2.0.9]: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AGLint/compare/v2.0.8...v2.0.9

Commits
  • cf0bb72 skipci: Automatic increment build number
  • f255c01 Update AGTree to v1.1.8, update workflows
  • fa55868 AG-30908 clean node_modules
  • d048fc2 AG-29862 Update integration guide with Husky 9
  • 4ccf69d Update Husky to v9
  • 31c3ab6 AG-25860 Add lint-staged to the integration docs
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=@adguard/aglint&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=2.0.8&new-version=2.0.9)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.title: bild.de

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: By Design
labels.description: The issue cannot be resolved due to technical, ethic, or legal reasons

issue.body:
## Information

### Deutsch

Sehr geehrte Benutzerin, sehr geehrter Benutzer, aufgrund von Gesetzen ([z. B. die Gerichtsentscheidung in Karlsruhe, Deutschland im Jahre 2018](https://www.morgenpost.de/wirtschaft/article214069831/Karlsruhe-erlaubt-Werbeblocker.html)) ist es leider nicht möglich diese Paywall (Adblock-Erkennung) zu umgehen. Vielen Dank für Ihr Verständnis.

### English

Dear user, due to a court decision ([eg the court ruling in Karlsruhe, Germany in 2018](https://www.morgenpost.de/wirtschaft/article214069831/Karlsruhe-erlaubt-Werbeblocker.html) ) it is unfortunately not possible to bypass this paywall (adblock detection). Thank you for your understanding.

comment.body: When will you finally fix this??? This article literally says that Adblockers are legal in Germany too. What the heck are you doing, I'm paying you to fight this kind of censorship. Stop giving in to random trash companies, or I'll cancel my subscriptions!! This is bullshit

issue.title: using adguard mobile ads filter makes Facebook scroll jump back

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

none

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

m.facebook.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List

### Social Widgets

Fanboy's Social Blocking List

### Annoyances

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, EasyList Cookie List

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

EasyList Italy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Browser: Firefox mobile 124.2.0

Ublock origin version: 1.57.0

Android version: miui 14.0.13.0.TKOEUVF

Hello. While I scroll Facebook home in the browser often it goes back enough to send to the previous post I've seen. It does the reverse thing if I try to scroll back, jumping forth. Disabling adguard mobile ads filter this behaviour stops.

Looks like its related to ads not being shown but not correctly handled, I could be wrong though.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
